Articles.Content:
This is the last update to KSP this year. Back in version 0.18.2, Eeloo was added as a Christmas gift of sorts.

So... has anyone found something yet in 0.23?

- An unlisted feature?

- New easter egg?

- Return of Magic Boulder?

- Anything? ...

Edited December 18, 2013 by bsalis

Ummm.. The camera now automatically adjusts when you enter or leave a SOI.

All I want is moar parts.. And fairings.. And planets.. and chocolate.

MJ

This is the last update to KSP this year. Back in version 0.18.2, Eeloo was added as a Christmas gift of sorts.

So... has anyone found something yet in 0.23?

- Return of Magic Boulder?

- Anything? ...

Err, I can't seem to get it to spit out the "Orbit Started" lines (Not even for a single planet) So I guess looking for it is the only way to find out.
Supposedly Minmus has regions... I'll visit it to see what's it all about if my lander on one plateau doesn't have enough fuel to enter orbit.

Ummm.. The camera now automatically adjusts when you enter or leave a SOI.

I have noticed some camera changes too. Swifter rotation when changing view.

Err, I can't seem to get it to spit out the "Orbit Started" lines (Not even for a single planet) So I guess looking for it is the only way to find out.

Damn.

/cry

Mebe someone will go on the hunt (i'm to lazy)

I haven't really found any surprises other than bugs with SAS and EVA Monoprop.

I noticed and really like the fixed IntakeAir pooling, which is not in the ChangeLog, but was mentioned somewhere.
Yes, Minmus seems to be rich with regions, check it out here.

Err, I can't seem to get it to spit out the "Orbit Started" lines (Not even for a single planet) So I guess looking for it is the only way to find out.

Alternatively, you could try to find every Orbit or OrbitDriver in the game. Anything that's orbiting anything else will have one of those, so if it exists, MB would have one.

Love that Kerbals on EVA can collect science data and return with it. Granted, this is documented, but I think it is way Cool. It allows for much more economical designs as you don't have to bring all the science parts back. Also, Apollo-style missions will be easier. Plus, with the lab module to "clean" the science equipment, you could send science missions out from an orbiting space station in reusable science vessels and return the data to KSC with crew rotation as you send the science vessels out again to a different location.

So has anyone used any tools dig up all the objects in orbit?

The fact that the "Orbit Started" messages were removed is suspicious.
I think it is now easier to grab the ladder of the starter pod without starting to dance wildly away from it?

Just noticed this...

In .22 and earlier, if your R-click on a part in flight, you get the popup context (so you can transfer fuel etc). If you R-clicked again somewhere, it disappeared. Now in 0.23, they are more sticky and remain shown. Which is neat since I use them to monitor fuel drain.

So has anyone used any tools dig up all the objects in orbit?

The fact that the "Orbit Started" messages were removed is suspicious.

Their hiding the magic boulder probably.

But,

What if there's something else out there?

Everyone bring your lazors to bop! Lol

I have noticed some camera changes too. Swifter rotation when changing view.

Damn.

/cry

Mebe someone will go on the hunt (i'm to lazy)

I haven't really found any surprises other than bugs with SAS and EVA Monoprop.

I noticed and really like the fixed IntakeAir pooling, which is not in the ChangeLog, but was mentioned somewhere.

Ehh, screw it, I'll go to Ike and check it out, hopefully it's come back.

(Maybe they added Russel's Teapot in between Kerbal and Eve and didn't want people easily figuring out what kind of an orbit it's in )

Well, I'm currently landed near the north pole of Ike searching the skies for a flicker of a pixel (real intense stuff here, eh?). I will provide you guys with the save file to help with the search.

Save file: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/wny4fpug2g1fax8/VyMtp82gFW
